addAttachment

public void addAttachment(java.lang.Object attachment)
addAttachment includes an object or file with this message object.
Parameters:
attachment:Ljava.lang.Object - encapsulating the data for the attachment to this message.

getAttachments

public java.lang.Object[] getAttachments()
getAttachements returns an array of attachment objects for this message object.
Returns:
a [Ljava.lang.Object array of the message attachements or null if this message does not contain any attachments.

getContactName

public java.lang.String getContactName()
getContactName returns the name of the person who sent this message object.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.String object of the sender of this message object.

getFromAddress

public java.lang.String getFromAddress()
getFromAddress returns the address/email address of the sender of this message object.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.String object representation of the address or e-mail address.

getMessageContents

public java.lang.Object getMessageContents()
getMessageContents returns the body of the message.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.Object representation of the body of this message object.

getPriority

public int getPriority()
getPriority returns the priority of this message, hence the message's importance (urgent).
Returns:
an integer value specifying the level of importance, where 1 represents the highest priority and 10 specifies the lowest priority.

getSubject

public java.lang.String getSubject()
getSubject returns the subject of this message object, usually a short explanation/summary of the body.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.String containing the subject of the message.

getTimeStamp

public java.util.Date getTimeStamp()
getTimeStamp returns the time that the sender sent this message.
Returns:
a Ljava.util.Date object representing the time that the user sent this message.

getToAddress

public java.lang.String getToAddress()
getToAddress returns the recipient's address/email address.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.String object of the recipient's address.

getUsername

public java.lang.String getUsername()
getUsername is the alias/handle of the person sending the message.
Returns:
a Ljava.lang.String object of the person's alias, or handle in order to identify the person if the contact name is not specified.

notifySenderMessageRead

public void notifySenderMessageRead()
notifySenderMessageRead notifies the person who sent the message that the recipient read his/her message.

sendCarbonCopies

public void sendCarbonCopies(java.lang.String[] copies)
sendCarbonCopies sends potential other people copies of this message.
Parameters:
copies:[Ljava.lang.String - object of address/email addresses of people who should be cc'ed this message.

setContactName

public void setContactName(java.lang.String contactName)
setContactName sets the contact name of the person sending this message object. This is also represents the name of the person to which replies of the message will be sent.
Parameters:
contactName:Ljava.lang.String - object containing the sender's name.

setFromAddress

public void setFromAddress(java.lang.String from)
setFromAddress sets the sender's address/email address.
Parameters:
from:Ljava.lang.String - object containing the sender's address.

setMessageContents

public void setMessageContents(java.lang.Object message)
setMessageContents sets the body of the message object. Usually this is a textual message of some predefined format.
Parameters:
message:Ljava.lang.Object - containing the contents of the message body.

setPriority

public void setPriority(int priority)
setPriority sets the priority of this message, the importance of this message (urgency).
Parameters:
priority - is an integer value specifying the importance of this message, where 1 represents immediate attention and 10 represents non-urgent messages.

setSubject

public void setSubject(java.lang.String subject)
setSubject sets the message subject, a short summary about the purpose of the message.
Parameters:
subject:Ljava.lang.String - containing the subject content.

setTimeStamp

public void setTimeStamp(java.util.Date timeStamp)
setTimeStamp sets the date at which this message is created. Note that the sender should not be setting this value, rather the message dispatcher should send this message prior to sending this message.
Parameters:
timeStamp:Ljava.util.Date - is the time at which this message is sent.

setToAddress

public void setToAddress(java.lang.String to)
setToAddress sets the recipients address/email addres.
Parameters:
to:Ljava.lang.String - containing the recipient's address or email address.

setUsername

public void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
setUsername sets the alias or handle of the user sending the message. Note that the user should be the one setting the alias, and the system should call this method only if a contact name or alias was not specified. The system should then set the username to be the handle of the email address.
Parameters:
username:Ljava.lang.String - containing the sender's alias or handle.
